entities.name: ANGLO-SAXONS
entities.description: Germanic tribes that arrived in Britain in the 5th century, bringing their language which developed into Old English

entities.name: BRITAIN
entities.description: The geographical area where the Anglo-Saxons arrived and where Old English began to develop

entities.name: OLD ENGLISH
entities.description: The language spoken in England from the 5th to the 11th century, heavily influenced by Germanic languages

entities.name: NORMAN CONQUEST
entities.description: The invasion of England by the Normans in the late 11th century, leading to significant changes in the English language

entities.name: NORMANS
entities.description: The ruling class in England after the Norman Conquest, who spoke Old Norman, a dialect of Old French

entities.name: MIDDLE ENGLISH
entities.description: The language spoken from the 11th to the 15th century, characterized by the introduction of many French words and significant transformations in vocabulary, pronunciation, and grammar

entities.name: GEOFFREY CHAUCER
entities.description: A prominent writer in Middle English, known for works such as "The Canterbury Tales"

entities.name: WILLIAM CAXTON
entities.description: The inventor of the printing press in England, whose work contributed to the standardization of the English language

entities.name: EARLY MODERN ENGLISH
entities.description: The language spoken from the late 15th century to the mid-17th century, marked by the Great Vowel Shift and the works of William Shakespeare

entities.name: WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE
entities.description: One of the greatest writers in the English language, whose works exemplify Early Modern English

entities.name: BRITISH EMPIRE
entities.description: The global empire that spread English to various parts of the world during the 18th and 19th centuries

entities.name: 20TH CENTURY
entities.description: The period during which English solidified its status as a global language, becoming the lingua franca of international communication, business, and diplomacy

entities.name: TECHNOLOGY
entities.description: A field that has significantly influenced the spread and evolution of the English language in the 20th and 21st centuries

entities.name: SCIENCE
entities.description: A field that has contributed to the widespread use of English in the 20th and 21st centuries

entities.name: ENTERTAINMENT
entities.description: An industry that has played a role in the global spread of the English language

entities.name: GLOBALIZATION
entities.description: A process that has influenced the spread and evolution of the English language, contributing to its status as a global language

entities.name: THE CANTEBURY TALES
entities.description: A collection of 24 stories that run to over 17,000 lines written in Middle English by Geoffrey Chaucer

entities.name: GREAT VOWEL SHIFT
entities.description: A major change in the pronunciation of the English language that occurred between the 15th and 18th centuries, affecting the pronunciation of many words

entities.name: AMERICAN ENGLISH
entities.description: A variety of English spoken in the United States, which developed from the English brought by British colonists

entities.name: AUSTRALIAN ENGLISH
entities.description: A variety of English spoken in Australia, which developed from the English brought by British colonists

entities.name: INDIAN ENGLISH
entities.description: A variety of English spoken in India, which developed from the English brought by British colonists

entities.name: GLOBAL LANGUAGE
entities.description: A language that is used for communication between people from different linguistic backgrounds, with English being a prime example

entities.name: LINGUA FRANCA
entities.description: A language used as a common language between speakers whose native languages are different, with English serving this role in many contexts

relations: The Anglo-Saxons arrived in Britain, bringing their language which developed into Old English
The Anglo-Saxons' language evolved into Old English
The Norman Conquest led to significant changes in Old English, leading to the development of Middle English
The Norman Conquest led to the Normans becoming the ruling class in England
The Normans' language, Old Norman, influenced the development of Middle English
Geoffrey Chaucer wrote in Middle English, contributing to its literary legacy
Old Norman, spoken by the Normans, influenced the development of Middle English
The Canterbury Tales is a collection of stories written by Geoffrey Chaucer in Middle English
William Caxton's printing press helped standardize and spread Early Modern English
William Shakespeare's works exemplify Early Modern English
The Great Vowel Shift altered the pronunciation of many words in Early Modern English
The British Empire's global influence contributed to the spread of English in the 20th century
The British Empire's influence led to the development of American English
The British Empire's influence led to the development of Australian English
The British Empire's influence led to the development of Indian English
The 20th century saw the widespread use of English in technology, further cementing its global status
The 20th century saw the widespread use of English in science, contributing to its importance as a global language
The 20th century saw the widespread use of English in entertainment, further spreading the language globally
The 20th century saw the influence of globalization on the spread and evolution of the English language
The 20th century saw English solidify its status as a global language
The 20th century saw English become the lingua franca of international communication, business, and diplomacy
